oh! what a shitty 'Hollywood like' movie that is. Just to listen to the music during the attacks, I want to puke.  Black hawk down (2001), Stalingrad (1993), these are great war movies. But this piece of craps full or cheap morale and sorry ass feelings ain't. This is a movie for GAY!

You kiddies who grew up with "Rambo" as a classic make me laugh.  

If you're older than 25, then you might have some experience watching real war movies.  If not, well, then you'd think that "Black Hawk Down" is a classic war movie.

This movie might not be a classic, but it is closer to one than any "war" movie made in the last 20 years.  

Sure, it's not a "Saving Private Ryan", but that is just a good movie, not a good WAR movie.

This movie was actually very entertaining, and took an aspect of World War One that I only had a cursory knowledge of, and gave it a lot more depth.  They don't go into a lot of detail about the mining operations during World War One in school, if at all.

I'm glad I saw this movie.
